TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebServiceHandlerFactory extends System.Object implements class System.Web.IHttpHandlerFactory

Docs.summary: Dynamically manufactures Web service handler instances, whose type or types implement the interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.IHttpHandler> interface establishes the contract that ASP.NET uses to process incoming HTTP Web requests with custom HTTP handlers. The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.WebServiceHandlerFactory> class produces an instance of an <xref:System.Web.IHttpHandler> implementation for handling Web service requests.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Web.IHttpHandler GetHandler (System.Web.HttpContext context, string verb, string url, string filePath);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.IHttpHandler GetHandler(class System.Web.HttpContext context, string verb, string url, string filePath) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides references to intrinsic server objects (For example, , , , and ) used to service HTTP requests.
The HTTP data transfer method (GET or POST) that the client uses.
The raw URL of the requested resource.
The file-system path of the requested resource.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ReleaseHandler(class System.Web.IHttpHandler handler) cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks There are no resources associated with a handler instance that the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.WebServiceHandlerFactory> class needs to release.
